line_1: Yet, when the rage of battle ceas'd,
line_2: The victor's soul was not appeas'd:

line_1: The clouds dispers'd, the storm and tempest ceas'd,
When Calms invite, and angry Storms are ceast,
line_2: He drives the Stream, and hastens to his Rest.

line_1: At length soft Peace look'd back; the Troubles ceast,
line_2: And pitying Heaven gave the Kingdoms Rest.

line_1: " For while the anthem swell'd, and when it ceased,
line_2: "Th' expecting people view'd their slumbering priest:

line_1: This said, her loud Complaint of force she ceas'd,
line_2: Excess of Grief her faultring Speech suppress'd.

line_1: And all the sacred agitation ceas'd.
line_2: His senses from the heav'nly trance releas'd,

line_1: To shew in me that Wonders were not ceas'd;
line_2: But there, as if Eternal Power had pleas'd
Was seen Lord John of the East.

line_1: Ah, well for him if here his suff'rings ceas'd,
line_2: And ample hours of rest his pains appeas'd!

line_1: By its own Force destroy'd, Fruition ceas'd;
line_2: And always weary'd, I was never pleas'd.

line_1: And when, at length, their crystal Sluices ceas'd,
line_2: The joyful Hero thus the Nymph address'd:
